Gui

Class QAnimationTabbedPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JTabbedPane
            • Gui.QAnimationTabbedPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class QAnimationTabbedPane
extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane
    An tabbed animation area used to display the probability histogram of the simulators states and the vector rotation of Grover's Algorithm.
    Author:
    William Hunter McNichols
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • QAnimationTabbedPane

        public QAnimationTabbedPane()
        Basic setup of the tabbed area. Calls functions to set up the desired animation tabs

    • Method Detail

      • updateHistogram

        public void updateHistogram(double[] regValues)
        Changes the values of the histogram to reflect the input in regValues. Should be called by the QViewModel and not directly. N.B. This operation is slow because it re-renders the entire graph and should be called sparingly
        Parameters:
        regValues - The values of the registers indicating the probability of each state

      • updateVector

        public void updateVector(double xval,
                double yval)
        Changes the value of the red vector in the vector rotation animation. Should be called by the QViewModel and not directly. N.B. This operation is slow because it re-renders the entire graph and should be called sparingly
        Parameters:
        xval - The new x value of the red vector
        yval - The new y value of the red vector

      • showVector

        public void showVector(boolean b)
        Called by the QuantumGuiPanel to display/remove the vector rotation tab
        Parameters:
        b - A boolean indicating whether or not the vector rotation tab should be displayed
